      • getOwnedTickets

        @GetMapping(produces={"application/json","application/xml"})
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Ticket>> getOwnedTickets​(@RequestHeader(value="Authorization",required=false)
                                                                                       java.lang.String jwt,
                                                                                       @RequestParam(value="buyConcert",required=false)
                                                                                       java.lang.Long concertId)
                                                                                throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Get ticket of authorized user Example: Get ../songWS/rest/tickets

        Get a new Ticket Example: Get ../songWS/rest/tickets?buyConcert={id}

        Parameters:
        jwt - Jwt Token
        concertId - id of concert to get ticket
        Returns:
        owner tickets and 200 or 201 if ticket created
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - URISyntaxException

      • getTicketQR

        @GetMapping(value="/{id}",
            produces="image/png")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<byte[]> getTicketQR​(@RequestHeader(value="Authorization",required=false)
                                                                   java.lang.String jwt,
                                                                   @PathVariable("id")
                                                                   java.lang.Long ticketId)
        Get qrCode for ticket Example: Accept: image/png Get ../songWS/rest/tickets/{id}
        Parameters:
        jwt - Jwt Token
        ticketId - id of ticket to get ticket
        Returns:
        owner tickets or 200 if ticket added

      • deleteTicket

        @DeleteMapping("/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> deleteTicket​(@RequestHeader(value="Authorization",required=false)
                                                                              java.lang.String jwt,
                                                                              @PathVariable("id")
                                                                              java.lang.Long ticketId)
        Delete a specific Ticket Only authorized owner of playlist can delete his own playlists Example: Delete ../songsWS/rest/ticket/{id}
        Parameters:
        jwt - Jwt token
        ticketId - id of ticket to be deleted
        Returns:
        HTTP NO CONTENT if playlist has been deleted, UNAUTHORIZED if not authorized, FORBIDDEN if trying to delete playlist that belongs to another user or BAD REQUEST
